name: Ground Turkey Soup with Beans
author: Kristina
summary: This ground turkey soup with beans is one of my favorite soups. We used to make this on snow days when I was a kid. I serve with saltines or Goldfish® crackers. It also makes a great leftover meal--always a plus!
ingredients: 4 medium red potatoes, cut in 1-inch pieces
1 (15 ounce) can whole peeled tomatoes, crushed
1 (15 ounce) can green beans, drained and rinsed
1 (15 ounce) can kidney beans, rinsed and drained
1 (15 ounce) can whole kernel corn, drained and rinsed
1 pinch seasoned salt (such as Morton® Nature's Seasons® Seasoning Blend), or to taste
1  bay leaf, or more to taste
1 cup water, or more to taste
directions: Crumble turkey into a stockpot over medium-high heat
Cook and stir until evenly browned, crumbly, and no longer pink, 7 to 10 minutes
Drain and discard any excess grease
Stir carrots, onion, and celery into the turkey; cook and stir until vegetables are soft, about 5 minutes
Add potatoes, tomato sauce, tomatoes, undrained peas, green beans, kidney beans, and corn
Season with pepper and seasoned salt
Pour water into the pot and bring to a simmer
Cover and cook, stirring regularly and adding more water as needed, until potatoes are tender, about 1 hour
